SHARIAH LAW.Definition: a religious law forming part of the Islamic tradition. It is derived from the religious precepts of Islam, particularly the Quran and the hadith

ROCKET LAUNCHER.Definition: a device that sends something such as a rocket or a missile into the air with force

SEIZE.Definition: to take something quickly and keep or hold it

EMERGE.Definition: to come to the end of a difficult period or experience

BALANCE OF POWER.Definition: a position in which both or all of the groups or people involved, usually in a political situation, have equal power

SEEN THE LIGHT.Definition: If you see the light, you suddenly understand something you didn't understand before

ENDORSEMENT.Definition: the act of saying that you approve of or support something or someone

CONDONE.Definition: to accept or allow behaviour that is wrong

LURKING.Definition: a lurking person or animal is waiting where he, she, or it cannot be seen, usually waiting to attack or do something bad

TRICKY.Definition: If a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill

PROXY.Definition: authority given to a person to act for someone else, such as by voting for them in an election, or the person who this authority is given to

MUJAHEDDIN.Definition: fundamentalist Muslim guerrillas; in Afghanistan in 1992 the mujaheddin overthrew the government but were unable to agree on a constitution due to factional conflict and in 1996 Taliban forces seized power

LONG STORY SHORT.Definition: used when you do not tell all the details

MISMANAGEMENT.Definition: the process of organising or controlling something badly

STABILITY.Definition: a situation in which something is not likely to move or change

STAMPING OUT.Definition: to get rid of something that is wrong or harmful

LAWLESS.Definition: not controlled by laws, or illegal

PROPOSITION.Definition: an offer or suggestion, usually in business

STRINGS ATTACHED.Definition: If something such as an agreement has strings attached, it involves special demands or limits

MADRASSAS.Definition: schools where people go to learn about the religion of Islam

ENFORCED.Definition: to make people obey a law, or to make a particular situation happen or be accepted

CONVICTED.Definition: having officially been found guilty of a crime in a law court

AMPUTATIONS.Definition: cutting off of part of the body

BURQAS.Definition: a piece of clothing that covers the whole head and body, with a hole for the eyes, worn by some Muslim women

CHAUVINISTIC.Definition: believing that or behaving as if women are naturally less important, intelligent, or able than men

INHUMANE.Definition: cruel and causing suffering to people or animals

RIVALRIES.Definition: a situation in which people, businesses, etc. compete with each other for the same thing

ARCHRIVAL.Definition: the chief rival of a person, team, or group

THROWBACK.Definition: a person or thing that is similar to an earlier type

MIDDLE AGES.Definition: a period in European history, between about AD 1000 and AD 1500, when the power of kings, people of high rank, and the Christian Church was strong

BARBARITY.Definition: behaviour that is very cruel, or a very cruel act

TOLERATED.Definition: to accept behaviour and beliefs that are different from your own, although you might not agree with or approve of them

HARBOURED.Definition: to protect someone or something bad, especially by hiding that person or thing when the police are looking for him, her, or it

REPORTEDLY.Definition: according to what many people say

ETHNIC.Definition: relating to a particular race of people

FRAUGHT.Definition: full of unpleasant things such as problems or dangers

TERRAIN.Definition: an area of land, when considering its natural features

BOOTS ON THE GROUND.Definition: soldiers, police, etc. who are physically present somewhere in a military or police operation

OPIUM.Definition: a drug made from the seeds of a poppy (= redflower) that is used to control pain or to help people sleep . It can make a person who takes it want more of it and is sometimes used by people as an illegal drug for pleasure

EXTRACT.Definition: to remove or take out something

LUCRATIVE.Definition: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money

IRONY.Definition: a situation in which something which was intended to have a particular result has the opposite or a very different result

REGAINING.Definition: to take or get possession of something again

FROM THE SIDELINES.Definition: If you are on the sidelines or do something from the sidelines, you are not actively involved in something

AGGRAVATES.Definition: to make a bad situation worse

FRINGE.Definition: the outer or less important part of an area, group, or activity

SIDELINE.Definition: something on the periphery, not a mainstream thing

ENGAGE WITH.Definition: deal with something, take part in something

SKEPTICS.Definition: a person who doubts the truth or value of an idea or belief

CYNICAL.Definition: believing that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

PLOY.Definition: something that is done or said in order to get an advantage, often dishonestly

ESTABLISH.Definition: to start a company or organisation that will continue for a long time

ABOLISH.Definition: to end an activity or custom officially

UNIVERSAL SUFFRAGE.Definition: the right for everyone to vote

GRAPPLING.Definition: to fight, especially in order to win something

DIVERTED.Definition: to cause something or someone to change direction

ENLIGHTENING.Definition: giving you more information about something
